main event: Multiple unexplained sightings of unidentified aerial objects at Camp Hood, Texas in April 1949 were reported by military personnel during their duties, including guard duty.
interesting points: The sightings were not associated with any apparent noise or odor, and there were no trails noticed, but there were consistent reports of a luminous glow similar to that of a kerosene lantern or a 75-watt light bulb.
The objects were observed to execute low arc maneuvers, fading out of sight, and reappearing at regular intervals of 5-15 minutes.
One sighting reported the object resembling a glowing bobbing baseball above the tree tops, moving from right to left and changing colors from white to red to green.
Radar targets were also reported, showing distinct blips consistent with the size and movement of the observed objects.
Observers were military personnel with no reported hobbies and were generally regarded as good observers by the interrogators.
witnesses: Military personnel including soldiers on guard duty
